intro: Heliophila variabilis, commonly known as variable heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, and it blooms from June to August. Heliophila variabilis is often found in meadows, riverbanks, and damp woodlands, where it plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
